location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 25 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is acknowledging the receipt of a communication, dated 24 March 1823, respecting captured boats received by the people of Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd, the Imam of Muscat. It notes that the Resident has written to the Imam on the matter.
